reasoning: This is a ticket creation task, not code implementation. It involves systematically parsing coverage.md to extract ~150+ uncovered test cases and creating ticket specifications for each. While high volume, the work is mechanical and pattern-based with no external dependencies or research required.

scope.notes: Only ticket specification files will be created. No actual test code or source code modifications. The main input is coverage.md which is a single well-structured document.

integrations.notes: No external integrations. This is purely a documentation/planning task involving parsing markdown and creating ticket specs.

infrastructure.notes: No infrastructure impact. Only creates ticket definition files.

knowledge.notes: The coverage.md document is well-structured with clear patterns. Each uncovered test is marked with [ ] and has a context/category. Ticket creation follows existing spec patterns.

concerns: Ensuring all uncovered tests are captured
Ticket granularity - one ticket per test vs grouping
risk.notes: Low risk since this creates planning artifacts, not executable code. The main risk is missing some uncovered tests during extraction.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: This is a ticket creation task that produces planning artifacts, not executable code. Minimal validation to verify tickets were created correctly. No security or deployment considerations.

task_characteristics.ticket_structure: Each ticket covers: 1) Write specific test, 2) Update coverage.md checkbox
task_characteristics.special_workflow: If test discovers bug: merge failing test first, create separate bug-fix ticket
categories_to_process: Ternary Operator (in function arg, array index)
